name: Black Arch Linux
description: Black Arch is an Arch Linux-based penetration testing distribution for security researchers and ethical hackers. It includes thousands of tools organized into categories.

sections.title: Early Years
sections.text: BlackArch was launched in 2013 as an unofficial Arch spin focused on cybersecurity, designed to be lightweight, modular, and comprehensive.

sections.title: Growth and Development
sections.text: The distro expanded its repository to include over 2,800 tools for penetration testing and security research, which can be installed individually or in groups.

sections.title: Current Status
sections.text: BlackArch is continuously updated and maintained by a global community. It is available as a live ISO or as a repository for existing Arch installs.

sections.title: Modular Tool Integration
sections.text: BlackArch allows users to install specific categories of tools without bloating the system, making it ideal for tailored security setups.
